result.execSummary:
The defendant James H Curd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eiligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Domestic Violence or Anger Management Treatment and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No contact with the victim/witnesses/family members or residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - all standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6:00 p.m. on 04-01-2016.
Apply 47 days sentence credit.
Defendant to serve an additional 30 days.
Last 48 days STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant James H Curd in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.
Victim Notification Has Been Complied With.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  4 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Treatment and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim/witnesses/family members or residence listed in the complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
 47 Days Credit.
Defendant to serve an additional 30 Days.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6:00 pm. on 04/01/16.
Last 48 Days STAYED-To be used at agent's discretion.
